name: Houston Tindol
text: Great doctor and nursing staff would definitely recommend!

name: Cheyenne Browning
text: Went to Dr gammill for 2 years. Did nothing for me. Complained of foot/heel pain and inflammation... told me to take some water pills and stay off it. Yeah no. I've had liver issues for a while now.. was told after one ultrasound 2 yrs ago that it was fatty liver with no further testing or help. I have more issues than that. I can't lose weight despite doing everything in my power and telling Dr gammill that I eat less than 1200 calories a day and on average closer to 800 but can't lose, he just notes in my chart obese due to excessive calorie intake. To say it was a bad two years is an understatement.  Went to a new dr and first day my foot issue was diagnosed and now has been treated. 2 years of pain for a simple fix. I am also on my way for help with thyroid issues. So no I would never recommend this office in a billion years.

name: Christi Hughes
text: One of his nurses was rude would not let me speak.

name: Stephanie Baggio
text: I used to see Dr Gammil. I really liked him my first visit. I went in for bad lower back pain. But after two appointments that were scheduled and I’d go in to and them telling me I didn’t have an appointment, then being thrown on his student doctor and all of my concerns disregarded, I stopped going in. I haven’t been in a year. He is the doctor I went to about my back pain, so when I went to see about physical therapy to help my pain since he refused to do anything, he also refused to just sign the form allowing me to have the physical therapy. It’s not like I’m trying to get on drugs or do anything unhealthy. This office is extremely unorganized, unprofessional and just awful. I absolutely will not go into this office again.

name: ronny reynolds
text: Good bed side manners. Very thorough.

name: Justin Medley
text: I've only been one time but it wasn't a good experience. The staff up front is polite but the nurse is incredibly rude and judgmental. She tried making me leave bc she thought I just wanted pain meds even though I was there for an infection. Once I cleared that up, I never even saw Dr Gammill, but a NP or medical student. Overall, I was disappointed.

name: Kye Kelli Underwoods
text: Dr. Gammill is the best and most knowledgeable Doctor in all of Enterprise Al.  He cares about his work, his patients, and his staff. He is very passionate about his profession, and his patients. Writing a review about him not refilling your prescription based only on your "word" that pills were stolen from your pill bottle is quite RIDICULOUS! There are rules and regulations that ANY doctor has to follow.Just because you said someone stole them does not mean it is true. (If it was true I am truly am sorry for you.) But once again that is not the Doctors fault and should not have to feel that it is. He has a family to take care of at home and he should not have to and will not have to put his career and income on the line for you. Also if the doctor was the one that asked all the questions why should he pay a nurse to do it?? THAT IS WHAT HE HIRED HER/HIM FOR.  He has a Nurse to get your info, symptoms, and general questions and concerns relays these things to the doctor and he comes in recommends what you need and gets you ready to go. My question to you is if you were so concerned about him not asking questions why did you not ask him questions on your concerns???? Works both ways. Make sure your fingers are clean before you bash someones career and office. No one forced the medicine on you, he simply recommended this to you. It's your choice to follow through with it. Or since your all about asking questions why didn't you ask if there was another alternative for you since you were breast feeding. Make sense huh!!!! I could go on and on about the ignorance of people to right reviews because they didn't get there way. If you don't like what a Doctor recommends for you by all means find a new Doctor that more fits you.

name: Lisa Norris
text: I have seen Dr gammil for about 6 years, I have degenerative spine, and anxiety/ panic disorder and have been under Dr care for 20 + years my last appt he cut me from pain medication and anxiety meds he has reduced my quality of life tremendously with his actions ,he doesn't care about his patients problems and he spends 5 minutes with you ,doesn't even make eye contact with you , worst doctor I have every been too ,would not recommend anyone that is looking for a doctor, stay away from this office , very bad patient care and rude and hateful

name: Barbara Fortenberry
text: I take medication for anxiety and panic attacks. Someone stole 40 pills from me right after I got it refilled, which caused me to run out before I could get more. I called his office twice to see if he would send another prescription to my pharmacy. They never sent it so I called and talked to one of his nurses. She told me she had to talk to him about it. She came back on the phone and said he could not send the prescription until the date I could have gotten it refilled. I was even willing to pay for a few. He still wouldn't do it. He said there was an FDA regulation that didn't allow him to do it. I started crying on the phone and said I was on the verge of having a nervous breakdown. She told me to go the ER.  I wouldn't advise anyone to go see him. He doesn't care for his patients. In the meantime I am still very very nervous.

name: medical professional
text: I called to try and get an appointment for a new patient , the scheduler who took my call seemed to have no idea what to do took my information and ask to call me back in an hour when she found out how to proceed, i then received a very rude ( to say the least ) voicemail from the nurse , after this i decided i would rather have a doctor whos office staff was a little more capable and friendly since in reality that is who you deal with the most. i would not recommend this office to anyone.

text: Dr Charles Crow is a great doctor. He takes the time to listen to what you have to say and he always answers your questions in a way that you can understand what he's saying. He has a great nursing staff and the receptionists are nice and professional as well.

text: Dr Crow is excellent. Very through and covers all areas of any problems you have had in the past.

resp.text: We strive to provide great experiences. Thank you for your feedback!

text: On the one hand, I love Dr Crow-he handles my quirky dad very well and very patiently. On the other hand, the staff is lacking. I called with an urgent request for a referral 4 times in one week and no one ever returned my call. Unacceptable.

resp.text: We appreciate you bringing this experience to our attention. If you are willing, please contact us at 205-971-3021 so we can work towards a resolution. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Fred KAZZIE
text: Love Dr Crowe & staff!! Always great experience!! Highly recommend!!

resp.text: Our staff strive to provide the best care and experiences. Your recommendation means so much to us.  Thank you again for taking the time to share your comment. Have a great day!

name: Steve Carnohan
text: Dr. Crow is awesome. He still practices “old school” medicine where he looks you in the eye, actually listens to what you say, and isn’t typing notes into an iPad like so many others are today.  While I appreciate technology, and all of the positives that come with it, actual communication between doctor and patient can’t be replaced.

resp.text: We strive to provide great experiences. Thank you for your feedback! We sincerely thank you for the positive review!

text: I had an appointment today at 2:30. My grandmother has been going here for years since I was a little girl. My aunt also was a patient for many years. I made an appointment back in June. Today when I arrived, I was told that Dr. Foster wasn’t seeing any patients today and then when I complained about it, they took my insurance info and took over an hour to verify it for a copay. Once I was finally told to pay, I was then told they didn’t accept cards. I offered to reschedule as long as it wouldn’t be over a month’s wait....Well I was told I wouldn’t be able to come back until November. This entire appointment was VERY Inconvenient because no one called me ahead of time and told me anything also I’ve been waiting since JUNE!  This was a horrible, horrible first impression and I’m very disappointed! To have to wait another two months after I’ve already waited 3 is very unacceptable and ppl should not be treated this way! This entire office has made their problems MY problems! Because they clearly forgot about the appointment! PI heard nothing but good things about this Doctor  and I even spoke with her on video chat about my grandmother and liked her personality. It’s so many other Doctors in the world and to be treated this way after I’ve waited is just ghetto!! Please do not waste your time if you are a new patient!! And if a business doesn’t accept cards in 2020, they clearly have a long way to go!!!

name: Clayton Baswell
text:
Let me start by stating I am a business owner... very rarely do I rate business with one start however this situation more than merited this rating. If it were possible to give less stars I would do so.

I have never been treated so disparagingly or with such utter patronizing disdain from a medical provider in my entire life. Gaile Prentice CRNP (not even a medical doctor mind you) was assigned to me when I called in for a general wellness check over a year ago.  After a not so pleasant initial experience with a CRNP who was clearly not well trained or very competent for that matter I thought I'll try again when I call back next time for another appointment with another doctor. Unfortunately you are assigned the same doctor for LIFE at this practice.

This is the most absurd practice concept I have ever heard of. Instead of seeking the best doctor patient relationship this practice cares more for administrative duties and collecting as many co pays as possible.

As my wife accompanied me to my appointment literally in tears pleading for  help with managing my general anxiety we were met with ZERO SYMPATHY and were denied a refill of an very common anti anxiety medication I have used in the past on multiple occasion when it was absolutely necessary to do so (valium).

Rather than attempting to dig into the problem she exasperated the issue and the most she would do was refer me to a psychiatrist. Never mind in Texas with my  primary care doctor I was able to get prescription refills without ever having to see such a doctor. They were more than competent and experienced enough handle simple issues like these.

I was treated with contempt and my personal integrity was questioned on multiple occasion regarding a medication I have been taking literaly for years.

Do not waste your time with this practice. Do not waste your time with Gaile Prentice, she is utterly unsympathetic, contentious, and unqualified as a Certified Nurse Practitioner to act as a primary care provider.

name: R.Allen Crowe
text: So I just retired from the United States Navy after 28 years of service.  My family and I moved to Mobile, Alabama for our last move as we intend to live here for the rest of our lives.  Well as in any place you live there are many good things and there are not so good things that you experience.  We just came across a not so good thing and that is the Alabama Medical Group, P.C.  We were only with this PCM and the medical group for 3 or 4 months when we received in the mail a letter from them dismissing one of my family members.  The letter did not state any reason why only that they “need to do this from time to time.”  When asked why our family member was dismissed their representative would not provide a reason and on top of that they were rude during our phone conversation.  As a Navy Captain (retired) who has been to many places in this world along with my family who have been with me through all of that,  this has been the most disappointing experience of my career and was upsetting for my family members.  As a result of this,  my entire family has now changed PCMs.  I hope this feedback will help the management of Alabama Medical Group to self reflect and make some changes for the better. In the meantime,  I would not recommend this facility if you are a veteran as I assume they do not hold the veteran status as important.  That is strictly my impression.

resp.text: Capt. Crowe, I've looked into the situation involving your wife's experience at our practice and due to HIPAA compliance regulations there is very little I can comment about her visit and post publicly on the internet. It's unfortunate to hear that she had a negative experience, and I would like to encourage her to call our office at 414-5900 and ask to speak to the operations manager or the marketing director so we can discuss the allegations in your comments above. One comment that I can, and would like to address, is your statement saying that we do not support veterans. That simply is not true. In fact, several of our physicians currently serve in the military, along with members of our staff, as well as their spouses. We appreciate their service to our country along with yours and the other men and women who chose to make that sacrifice to protect and serve our great nation.

Dr. Burch was fairly patient with my questions and answered them at least, however I do remember her not telling me the potential price of the DNA testing and blood work which I would have liked to know before officially asking to have those tests done. Overall, she has a good demeanor and seems knowledgeable; however I would have liked her to be more patient and answer all my questions thoroughly, especially to give at least a range of prices for tests/procedures before a patient accept them.

name: Janelle Presnall Barbato
text: I would not trade Burch for any other Doctor! She knows her stuff and she cares. Love her and the staff

resp.text: Hi Jannelle, thank you for the 5-star review and the positive feedback. We think the world of Dr. Burch too!

name: Land Lord
text: Dr Burch won't be respectful of your time nor will she run on time. I walked out after she didn't show for my appointment. Patients beware! I would give no stars if possible.

name: Elise Barrows
text: Dr. Lisa Burch is an excellent doctor and I couldn’t be happier with the care she has provided me. She really listens to your issues/concerns and doesn’t try to rush you through your  visit. I find her caring, compassionate and non judgmental. She explains conditions and treatments in a way that are easy to understand and I trust her advice. Before I left my first visit, we scheduled a follow-up appointment which makes me feel Dr. Burch is committed to seeing me through to my healthiest, happiest self.

name: Stacy Corey
text: I wouldn't even give them a star, the first time I had called to set up an apt a man answered the phone who was totally rude and unprofessional I ended up setting the apt up anyway hoping the doc would be better than the Secretary and they couldn't get me in till almooat two months later! So I go in for my apt today and at first they seemed okay but then had a hard time finding my insurance since I have no card so my military husband told the lady all she had to do was put his SS# in and it should automatically show up but instead of listening to him she decided to roll her eyes at him and tell me I have to reschedule after already waiting almost two months... I got home called my insurance they didn't get why they couldn't find me n to have them call my insurance for any questions. Short story of it, I ended up calling them and canceling everything and switching docs that actually go out of their way to make sure your all set and taken care of properly with no attitude or eye rolling, and for the women who thought it was okay to do so.. keep rolling your eyes, maybe you'll find a brain back there.

name: Bernie Clemens
text: Dr Burch is top notch.  Could not ask for better.  The office staff is bottom notch.  They could use some lessons in scheduling  and basic customer service. It's not uncommon to be put in an exam and wait for 30+ before the dr shows up.

name: Danielle Burgess
text: Doctor Nazareno is very thorough and personal. It is hard to find a doctor with her kind of work ethic these days. If she says she will do it, she will. The staff is always nice to me too. Very awesome!

name: Georgia Patterson
text: Good place for medical emergency

name: Theron G
text: And she is a Bi---

name: john bass
text: THEY WON'T ANSWER THE PHONE LOL!!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Amanda Sieveking
text: Took my brother to see Dr Herndon because he just moved here and as a diabetic needed a primary care doctor. Dr Herndon was very thorough and attentive. Seemed very concerned about my brother and getting him all the care he needs. His staff was amazing , Chantelle his PA was awesome as well. So thankful I found this office and was able to get my brother in quickly. A+

name: Shoefly Gooch
text: Very professional, fast and Friendly. Dr. Herndon has old school class and new school knowledge.

name: Mark Harper
text: He was my Dr. for nearly a decade and then due to my lack of Health Coverage he chose to drop me when I needed him most.   Do yourself a favor and find a real Dr. who cares about people.

name: Matthew Baker
text: You must call him and make an appointment for each med you take, he runs test that aren't needed and then never cares to let you know about any test results. A really poor md . Money hungry .

name: Biju Nair
text: Wait times are not too bad...

name: Vivian F
text: Dr. Herndon is a well educated and knowledgeable clinician.

name: Brian Gothard
text: I have been a patient at Fairview clinic for nearly 15 years.  The staff and the doctors are outstanding.  I have had care from many doctors and nurses in the course of my life.  But none compare to the quality, consistency,and level of care that I receive from Fairview clinic.  Today I am 58 years old.  I am confident when I say that I would not be alive today if it weren't for the doctors and staff at Fairview clinic.

name: Kelly Floyd
text:
I want to thank Fairview Clinic and what they did for me today. The nurses, Dr. Justin. I was treated with respect and the utmost care.
It is very scary when you cant breathe and they set me at ease.
Thanks to all of you!
I highly recommend Fairview Clinic.
Wonderful people!

name: linda house
text: I am a currently a cancer patient currently dealing with chemo and then a mastectomy and this clinic is impossible to deal with.  I’ve never even been able to see them the first time.  I’ve never even been scheduled an appointment. Not my fault theirs. I really didn’t think that a doctor would be so uncaring. Myhealth insurance  doesn’t even require a referral for this clinic since they are on the approved infectious disease dr list. But they demand one and when you have scheduling conflicts like I do the chemo and surgeries, they aren’t patient friendly at all. So if you’re looking for an infectious disease doctor this is not the clinic you want to go to.  This clinic is not patient friendly at all and definitely not cancer patient friendly. Find somewhere else to go anywhere but here. trying to deal with them is a My dr referred me to Fairview clinic. With all my treatments, surgeries etc  apparently I didn’t call in a timely enough manner for them and they have told me now they can’t see me without another referral since 60 days have passed. When headache .

name: Regina Norwood
text: I would have given zero stars but...These people at fairview don't care about their "patients"Don't jeopardise your health!

name: Chasity Winborne
text: I would do no stars if that was even possible. Billing is all over the place. They tried to charge you for things that insurance requires to be done (which should be free), charge you for a "screening" when you walk in and tell them that you have something that has already been diagnosed by another doctor. Takes forever to return calls, rude staff.... I had my nurse tell me that I look "arab" (because of my face mask) and how terrifying that appears to people.... I sat there for well over 5 minutes while she spewed hateful comments at me.

name: Jim Reeves
text: We are fairly new to the area and needed a new family doctor.  This clinic was on our insurance and was taking new patents.  We chose to see Alexis Wood who is Dr. Robeson’s NP.  She is very good, very thorough and took plenty of time to get to know us.  Several months ago my husband was hospitalized after developing a complication from surgery and Alexis was so helpful in making sure that he got the care that he needed to relieve the terrible discomfort he was having and she everything in her power to contact the surgeon and make sure he was aware of our needs.

name: David Oltmans
text: I have noticed some negative reviews and I felt it necessary to post my experience at the Fairview Clinic.  I have been a patient at Fairview for around 20 years and have never received what I would consider less that excellent treatment from the medical professionals of this clinic. They have all ways been helpful, responsive and competent.  The Portal is a wonderful tool for communicating questions and for receiving timely answers, to include Rx refills. Keep up the good work, Fairview Team!

name: Lamar Spann
text: Dr. Robeson is wonderful, but the rest of the staff are not very good. My wife and I are up in age and we both feel as if they are only interested in the "money" and not the person. The staff are constantly trying to sell us our prescription medications and having us sign documents saying we will pay what the ins does not (and we always owe them money).  If we did not like Dr. Robeson, we would not go there. We are still considering swapping doctors due to the staff at the Clinic. (I would give Dr. Robeson 5 stars)

name: Sam Brown
text: Wonderful staff. Extremely smart doctors. I love Dr Masters.

name: Abby McNeil
text: I just waited TWO HOURS to see a doctor and never got seen . Finally got up and left. This is so disrespectful of your patients time .

text: Terrible! I was referred by my hematologist to see Dr Miller. Dr Miller tried to dimiss all my problems as sleep apnea and promised me lab results in 7-10 days. I have heard nothing and it's been 2 weeks. I am now being billed a $179 consultation fee that is not covered by my insurance. I have seen many specialist recently and only been charged my copay of $30, I have excellent insurance with no deductibles. This place is a scam!

name: Catherine Stephens
text: I had been showing Dr. Robeson a spot on my leg for year, he dismissed as "old people spots". Well, now after 7 surgeries for cancer.......

name: Jim Mooney
text: Dr Chris Miller a great Doctor

name: Jim Carr
text: He is the best physician I have seen in the last 20 years. He correctly diagnosed me and changed my medicine to the correct ones and has my health back where it should be.

name: Teri Hennington
text: Extremely knowledgeable, patient and caring physician. He is extremely up to date on the latest information in primary care and geriatric patient care. His staff is fantastic--responsive and technically adept.

name: Jim Galetsis
text:
I had been going to this office for 2 months after discharge from multiple hospital visits and got a letter today stating that I was being dismissed from his care for failiure to follow medical advice cause I can't afford Lovonox injections that cost $750. His office cancelled 3 appointments on me without any reason and then some woman afilliated with the office calls me to inform me that he'll only be seeing me for "emergency situations" from this point forward.

If I were you I'd save my time and find someone else to go to if you're unable to afford meds cause he'll discharge you too and try to make you look like you're not following his advice as well.

name: Ashley Storey
text: I am a teacher, and on the day of my new patient appointment, I was running a little late  to get there from school. I called the office to let them know and make sure it would still be OK. They told me it would be fine and to come on in as quickly as I could. When I got there, 12 minutes late, they told me they could not see me and I would have to reschedule. No thanks. Why tell somebody to come on in if you are just going to tell them to reschedule when they get there?

name: Mary Lamm
text:
Never late. Never have to wait for your appointment. Professional and friendly. Lots of the reviews I read here complain that doctor wouldn’t see them when they showed up late; this is how he keeps his appointments on time. Why should others have to wait because you cannot get there on time or want to see the doctor without an appointment?
Ignore the bad reviews.

name: Charles Barber
text: Still waiting for my records and orthopedics

name: Emily staley
text: He is the worse doctor I have ever seen. His bedside manner is horrible, and he has no problem turning people away who show up to their appointment for refills on their medicine because “he doesn’t feel comfortable seeing them”. I left his office in tears.

name: Alex Olive
text: I absolutely love Dr. Alred! She is so knowledgeable and very sweet. She cares about her patients and takes the time to listen to what the problem is. She never rushes through her appointments. I have been seeing her for a while now and I wouldn't trust any other doctor. Sometimes there is a wait - but it is SO worth it when you know that behind the door is a very loving doctor. Her staff is also very friendly. If I could give her 10 stars I would!

name: Cindy Simonetti
text: Wow. Dr. Alred is a rare find. She has taken so much time to get to know me, to understand my health concerns & issues, and starts with the facts. about me as a person. When something is wrong, she typically knows exactly what it is, but she doesn't play guessing games. She does the appropriate diagnostic testing and lab work to get to the bottom of what's going on. .I am a facts based person. She starts there and goes beyond by combining  her vast knowledge and me as a person, to come to the right diagnosis.  She genuinely does care about her patients. I don't know what I would do without her!

name: Brittani Sanford
text: What terribly run practice. Appt time was 2:30 pm. Was seen by Dr. Alred at 4:45 pm. No apology. When I questioned the staff as to how far behind she was running, no one could tell me. They indicated this was normal wait time and said to me "just because your appointment was 2:30 pm, doesn't mean that's when you should expect to be seen by the doctor." How do other patients manage to take a half a day off work for what should be a one hour visit? If you have tons of time to kill and enjoy sitting in doctors offices unattended to, Dr Alred is perfect for you.

name: Stephanie Simmons
text: She is one of the worst doctors I've ever known. Everything about this place is horrible. She just shuffles patients in and out without doing basic test such as blood work.

name: Paula Coker
text: I have used Dr. Alfred for many years, and she took care of my Mother for years. She may seem a bit unconventional, but her patients love her! I do, and she is a very knowledgeable diagnostician, I've found.

name: Cheryl Powell
text:
I absolutely LOVE Dr. Ginger Alred!!!! Not only does she love her patients, but she is very well equipped to take care of our Medical Needs. Dr. Alred is such a dedicated, determined, & driven doctor until she will not stop until she knows all of her patient's issues have been addressed & being taking care of.
The one thing I love the most about Dr. Alred is when she reminds me in her own unique & comical way that I do not have it all figured out. After listening to my little theory, she'll chuckle to herself & say..."Wellll if you try it this way, don't you think it would be better for you?!?" I just politely pick up my notebook, ink pen, & start taking notes!!!!
#gottaloveher
#DrGtotallyrocks

name: J B
text:
Dr. Alred is an outstanding physician.     She is patient oriented,  extremely knowledgeable,  and forward thinking.   I highly recommend her for anyone.
Jeannine Burton

name: m

name: Allwrite Now
text: Dr. Ramamoorthy is the best doctor I’ve ever seen. She is brilliant and kind. She also thoroughly explains medical issues and the options for treating them. She’s just as focused on preventative care as treatment, and she seems to genuinely care about her patients.

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us a 5 star rating - it's much appreciated!

name: Linda Curnel
text: I cant say enough wonderful things about Dr.Rama and her staff. I am a 69 yr old female and i have never been treated by a doctor and staff as wonderful as they are. If there is a recommendation chart from 1 to 5 i give them a million.

name: Melanie Paige Morris
text: Dr Ramamoorthy has an amazing bedside manner. She looks you directly in the eyes while providing great advice and education. Her expertise in general care is unmatched. She is a blessing to the Huntsville community!

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us a 5 star rating - it's much appreciated!

name: Krowe Ema
text: Dr. Rama is so attentive and listens to your concerns even if they just seem like your personal fear.  She really cares about your overall well-being - physical and mental. The office is friendly, welcoming, and easy to access on the ground floor.  Also, the parking is easily accessible unlike so many parking garages in town.  I would trust her with any of my family members from my 84 year old parents to my young adult children.  I feel like I finally found a doctor who will care for my medical needs.

resp.text: Thank you Ema. We appreciate your kind words.

name: Tiffany
text: A true professional in every sense of the word.

resp.text: Thanks Tiffany.

name: Alexandra Pickle
text:
Excellent doctor!!

Dr Ramamoorthy is very through, she considers the context of a problem - patient’s medical history, lifestyle, hereditary diseases, etc. She doesn’t waste time and money on unnecessary tests, but will order the lab work and tests that are truly needed.

Dr Ramamoorthy really cares about the patients. She calls me personally to discuss the test results or to follow up.

Scheduling is a breeze. The clinic is well organised. I never have to wait. I’m able to get a quick appointment if there is an issue.

I’m so happy to have found this clinic and doctor.  I’m in very good hands.

text: First I'm going to state the obvious, IF U ARE REALLY SICK, IN PAIN, OR POOR DO NOT GO TO THIS DOCTOR!! This doctor ad his PA's don't listen. I was out of my meds which is narcotic based and stopping them completely is dangerous. He refused to re-write my prescription or even see me unless I got blood out of a stone. I had a panic attack outside his office and crying and they called the COPS on me!! Very unprofessional. How can a doctor's office NOT recognize a panic attack and call an ambulance?!?! This doctor and his clinic don't care, all they want is money. I told his office manager that I don't drink, smoke or do drugs, I am just poor and sick! She didn't care and called the cops on me for being on their property, crying and sick. This doctor and his clinic are a disgrace to the medical profession!!

My Son died 2 months later, as he went to the streets-bought opioid that was laced with F’ how dare you Dr’s for doing this. I blame you!

text: Dr. Kopp seems competent, but you rarely see him and the PA I did see gave me incorrect information on at least two counts.

name: Chase Nelson
text:
Where to begin with this review?  My father was referred to see this practice for pain management. The staff is nonexistent, no one will actually answer your call or return a message, they will schedule you for an appointment, but do not bother contacting the patient to inform them that they've cancelled or rescheduled the appointment.  Further, force you to take a medication that the patient simply cannot afford and has severe side-effects, and care less to discuss with the patient alternative medications or treatments, or show any real concern about their patients' safety and well-being.
I do not recommend this group.  It's a complete waste of time and will cause you or your loved one more health issues.  Upon information and belief, it is blatantly apparent that what they want is a revolving door, i.e. ($$$)

name: Gregory Hall
text: This man has no passion for his patients. My quadriplegic brother was discharged with false statements due to simply smoking marijuana. (A known medical herb that is helping way more than the flooding of pills for profit.) I get it. It's not accepted in Alabama, but to completely discharge someone who is in need of such things more than the majority of the pill addict patients that have it easy in life is inhumane. What happened to doctors that loved humanity and truly had passion for that of their patients? A true doctor wouldn't give up on someone due to personal opinions on something that has been accepted as medicine across the WORLD! Now my brother suffers even more through his tragic accident. I highly do not recommend this insensitive fool. I wish doctors still cared for people rather than just the profit of people... Sigh

name: Wylie Arnett
text:
Actually Wylie Arnett ........was disappointed in the wait times  1 to 2 1/2 hours thought that was crazy
Then with everything going on other then PT & a few pain pills no real plan - I guess I was thinking  maybe a procedure was needed.  I've had multiple injuries & overwhelmed  ...... underprescribed at the time PA didn't want to hear it when I self reported- got back in basically begged  DR. Kopp to keep me on as a patient - he said well is there anything else we can do for you - I said yes help fix me - he gave me a prescription for water aerobics- which after sitting/standing in waiting room for another 45 minutes after 2 hour initial wait - I was like I'm outta here ........... here is the deal - they have to many patients- this is really just a low dose pill accountability clinic - they don't have time to be doctors or PA's they are just for accountability to the new opioid laws in Alabama ( reduction by all means )..........

Update had a collapsed vertebrae sitting on old broken rod from old fusion ....... Thanks for your NO help jacklegs ......... Not everyone is worthy of Doctor ....... Thank God I found a doctor to help

name: Melissa Norman
text: I wish I could give no stars. My husband never actually got to see the doctor, only a PA, who was a jerk. He's got bulging and herniated discs and has been seeing a doctor in Pensacola for years. We moved back to Alabama and it was just too hard to drive to Pensacola all the time, so we found this doctor. They have given him 4 epidurals in 2 months, lots of steroids, PT, and continued his pain medicine. He can hardly walk and I feel he may need surgery, but they don't listen and will NEVER call us back when we call. A very rude guy just finally called us back for the first time and said because he didn't have enough of his pain medicine in his system that they would no linger help him. He told them that he ran out because he was hurting so bad and the guy said oh well, we'll send you something in the mail. I understand that there are people who abuse pain medicine, I've seen it before, not with my husband, but I've had family that was addicted. The way he was so dismissive and basically said he didn't care was shameful! To throw away someone who is trying to get well because others screw up is ridiculous! Shame on you.

name: Loki M
text: I've met kopp 1 time since I've been going, the 1 time I did meet him, he discontinued his service to me after I requested to discuss why they never wrote the prescription to help wing me off the meds they wrongfully took from me, but he didn't want to discuss that, it obviously wasn't important to him , he was ok that I never received the meds his office stated I needed for how unsafe it was too stop without taking anything else. They were fine putting my life at risk, they got caught in their several lies and he needed me gone before I got more evidence on them, he has never, nor his assistant, ever touched me in a appt,but in records, they've done all kinds of tests on me, they have put me a couple times a month going 2-3 days without pills for not sending them to rx. They didn't care at all about it, but they wrote up I was rude at my appt for asking questions about it. Told me to bring in my scripts before the next fill date, which I did, and they stopped my scripts. Even doctored the notes to make me look like a "druggy", even though pill count always accurate"These guys are the dirtiest doctors that practice medicine in Mobile. Attorneys investigating my recordings vs their notes,TRUST ME when I say, going to be interesting in explaining A LOT of discrepancies in their notes vs their voices on a recorder. I hope they actually get a little time to think about how many people they have screwed over, hopefully 5-10 years of thinking..... They are a disgrace to their practiceo and their families, I'd be embarrassed to be related to anyone in that practice. The word will be spread, news channels will be offered chance to report on the discrepancies in notes vs recordings, pray for Justice to the victims of these disgraceful people......

name: John Czerepak
text: My wife and I's primary care physician, Dr. Joel Laughlin retired and I was looking for a replacement. Dr. Joiner was recommend to me by my cardiologist.  So I called her office to make appointments for both of us. When I asked the staff person if she was taking new patients I was told "Yes and no, it depends" I was told that she would take our information and give it to Dr. Joiner and that I would hear back either later that day, Sep. 3rd or the next day. Presumably Dr. Joiner would look over our information and decide if we were "good enough" to be her patients. So here it is 10 days later and it appears that whatever criteria Dr. Joiner uses to screen her patients, my wife and I didn't pass because I never heard back from them. I'm looking on the bright side of this. If that's Dr. Joiners attitude, that some people are good enough for her to see, and others are not, I am probably better off not having her for a primary care physician.

text: Dr. Joined is about the best physician I have ever had. She takes time to listen and has never rushed me. Her nurses are the best. I have always been treated with courtesy respect and kindness. Highly recommend.

name: Jessica M
text: Don’t get me wrong. Dr Joiner is very good and she actually listens to you and cares. However, I am mainly giving a 1 star because of the women at the front desk! I had to get a referral to go to urgent care for a very serious matter. I called Dr Joiners office to let them know I did visit the urgent care and gave them my referral for insurance. I also asked for the fax number and faxed it to them twice like I usually have done. Well this time I received a bill in the mail and they told me they did not get my referral! Now. I talked to a woman there that is over the referrals and she said that someone around that time had been fired and she may have had my referral information and it didn’t go through and was going to investigate for me. But I never did hear back from her. If the lady who I spoke with that day would have done her job And filed the referral on my insurance then I wouldn’t have to have this put on my shoulders. I did the correct protocol and would have brought the referral there myself but I have always called to give it over the phone and it was fine. The lady who was supposed to do her job never did. Even if it wasn’t the same woman who was fired, someone didn’t file my referral to my insurance. I have been going around and around with this since June of 2019 and it is still not resolved. I have switched drs because of this and I won’t go back.

text: I have been going to Brookwood Internists for many years. It is located next to Brookwood Hospital and the parking is easy. I have never had to wait to see my doctor! He knows my health situation and will prescribe meds I need without saying, “just take over the counter medicine and you will be fine!” My only complaint is communication; the Patient Portal does not work for me; therefore, I end up playing telephone tag sometimes. I was told today the Patient Portal is getting upgraded soon so communication should be easier.

name: Phillip Wiginton
text: I am a diabetic patient.  I misplaced by glucometer pouch with all the contents.  I called to ask that a new prescription be called in for a replacement.  I talked to a nurse.  She asked for what kind of glucometer would I like.  I told her I did not have mine to tell her exactly what kind I had.  I told her I would look online to try to find one like it.  After a few seconds, she raised her voice and yelled into the phone, "MY GOODNESS, ARE YOU THERE?"  I told her I wanted to talk directly to my doctor's nurse.  When then changed her tone and became more helpful.  I have read many of the reviews of similar behavior but I have not experienced it myself.  I love my Doctor and his nurse.  However, the upfront staff and lab staff frequently have bad attitudes.

text: I have been seeing the same physician at this clinic for twelve years. He is great so long as I am dealing with him directly. When he does so, I get a text message. I didn’t get a text message. I called and come to find out that my physician was out. Another physician printed a prescription. I hung up and called the front office and explained the situation. I asked if they could wait just five minutes past closing so my wife could get the prescription. They refused. My wife tried anyway and got to the door at 4:34. Door locked. Like I said, I’ve been going to this office for twelve years so I know they lock the door at 4:30 but by the time patients have all left it is close to five. Someone could have taken the high road and offered to hand my wife the prescription at 4:35. I’m dumbfounded at the callousness.

My first visit with Dr. Brandin Moore for a Wellness Check on June 17, 2021 was refreshing. He presented information about my lab work, medicines, and general health that were practical and easy to understand. He explained health procedures and options available to help monitor physical well being, for both now and in the future, but his overall emphasis is that the patient is in charge of her/ his health. He did not seem in a hurry and wanted to be sure all questions were answered and concerns addressed. I really appreciate the time and approach that Dr. Moore takes with his patients.
I would easily recommend him to anyone needing a physician for self or family.

name: Mary Robinson
text:
The supporting staff is severely lacking in professionalism. A few months ago I was stuck in a game of "phone tag" to reschedule an appointment, because the office has never answered the phone when I called. I eventually had to go out of my way to visit to reschedule the appointment.

More recently, I changed insurance providers and provided the staff with my new insurance card. I witnessed them copy the card, and as they returned the card, I was assured it would be provided to billing. Today I was notified by my previous insurance provider that my appointment was claimed on my expired contract. They close at noon on Friday's, so there is nothing I can do until Monday morning. I expect this event to unfold in a similar "phone tag" manner. I will provide updates.

Update: They answered my billing call on the first try and resolved the issue in a timely manner. I'll give them one more star for that (up from 2).

resp.text:
We are sorry you had this experience with our office. I will discuss this with our staff. However, we are suite A, Valley Internal Medicine and Pediatrics and we do not close at noon on Fridays. We do take a lunch from 12-1 daily.
Thank you for your review.

They know the story of our boys and have always asked for updates when we visit... that is huge for us! I also appreciate that they have a more natural approach to things that doesn't necessarily require prescriptions. text: Here’s another one to add to the long list of comments about not answering the phone. So so stressful that you can NEVER get anyone to answer. It’s supposed to text, call and email you but I’ve never EVER received one. I’ve made sure they had my correct contact info about 6 times and they do... they just fail to remind me and then charge their $50-$60 no show fee to my account when they don’t. I’ve been there for 2 years now but I can’t take it anymore and I’ll be finding a new doc soon. Save yourself the stress and go somewhere else.

Who ever the REAL DR's are here, you need to step in and clean house, the service we've recieved is an embarrassment of your business skills.  Due to the incompetense here, my FMLA to care for my ill mother was denied and I now have an attendance issue that could get me fired.  I'm sure it's no sweat off your backs, your jobs are fine. I've spent countless hour trying to speak to some one to get this sorted. They refuse me to speak to me, they refuse to treat me, refuse to help me with payments on the bills.

They have hung up on me on the phone. They have even tried tacking on several other costs for tests they never even tried to do. They will make a less then $70 bill turn in to hundreds.

I am currently seeking an attorney. They way these people work, act, speak to people and so on is horrible. These people have no heart in what they do.

GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!

Mainly,it's a crapshoot on care here.Which has gotten much worse since our Dr died in a 4by4 accident.

text: My mother goes to this practice and her Dr is awesome, but the office part is unorganized, rude, and plain unprofessional. name: K
text: At 19 years old I became a patient of Brad Ginevan MD. After my current pediatrician, Dr. Rivas, advised it was time to transition to an adult provider. During the time he was my provider, Dr. Ginevan worked alongside my psychiatrist to continue maintenance of my ADHD and when necessary, he worked with specialists to manage my delicate GI condition. This included references to appropriate clinics and scheduling of applicable tests ie. Colonoscopy, EGD, etc. I truly trusted Dr. Ginevan and was incredibly grateful to have found such a wonderful physician. I never minded the fact that his office was always moving locations or that his appointments had become a nightmare to secure. I still referred only my closest of friends and family to see him. Always assuring them they'd be nothing less than satisfied with him as they're provider. Those were the old days... in 2013 I moved away to live on base with my then husband. I moved back in 2015 and returned to Dr. Ginevan. He and his staff had undergone a complete restructuring as they were now a part of the mega-merger trend and had merged with the tri-cities health giant Shoals Primary Care LLC. Due to the merger Dr. Ginevan no longer had any of my previous medical records from all of my time spent under his care which led to massive complications to my continuity of care. (I now understand the importance of my responsibility to secure medical history documentation and maintain my own current updated personal medical record.) Also, SADLY, due to the implementation of a governmental-esque standard of operating procedures, it is my opinion that Dr. Ginevan no longer maintained the level of patient care he had became known for. His office staff has always been grade-A; to be commended. If you are considering seeing Dr. Ginevan as your primary care provider this review is for you. In closing I want to say that this review in no way, intends to slander or cause malice. This review is my personal experiential reference/opinions of Dr. Ginevan meant solely for the purpose of socially informing fellow peers.

text: I have seen many Drs from all over and these Drs has done a complete work up on me I am at Dr now and shoals primary Care has all the Drs you could need in this building I'm very pleased with them and they have their own machines here so you don't have to go to the hospital for any kind of scans  I give them 5 stars

name: Em Means
text: I had planned to start seeing Dr. Martin as a new patient after my husband's first visit (where they had down on his chart that he was a 60 year old female with impacted bowls). I ignored that fact and still decided to give the doctor the benefit of the doubt because I could understand things sometimes happen. However, upon my scheduled visit as a first time patient it was for 7:30 am, and I arrived at 7:15 am for new patient paper work. I signed in and no one even showed up at the front desk until my appointment time, where I  then asked for my paper work and filled it out. About ten minutes after that, another woman called me by the wrong name and when I corrected her, I was made to feel as if I had done something wrong. Also, you can not hear when you are being called because the TV is loud, so people are talking over the TV, and I have two ear infections. After filling out my paper work, I was then called back to the window, where I was asked to write down my SSN, but I had already written it down twice on the form already. This told me they obviously were not paying attention to the information they were entering. After this, and already feeling on edge from just the front desk experience, I am called back by the doctor's nurse practitioner who tells me to step on the scale, and with a horrible tone says, "you're going to have to take some of that off." Meaning my purse. I ask where I should put it in case of a designated area, which seem to make her even more annoyed and she replies with, "I don't know." Very snappy. I am a new patient and felt like I was asking a very simple and non offensive question. We then walk to the exam room where she informs me that I would not be seeing the doctor and that he also would never been doing my exams or ever seeing me other than a quick peek in the room. Which, as someone looking for a long term doctor, it does not feel comfortable not even meeting my doctor on the first visit. When I tried to explain that I was uncomfortable with the fact she would only be relaying my issues to the doctor, and that I didn't feel comfortable having my health looked after in third person, and that I didnt understand why they wouldn't tell a new patient to begin with when making an appointment that he or she won't be seeing a doctor. She then got upset about it and told me I could reschedule or abort because she had been doing this for 40 years. Which is fine and I explained to her I was fine with her seeing me, but that I didn't feel comfortable having a doctor diagnose me without speaking with me and knowing me as a person. She gets more upset and I said I think it would be best just to cancel because at that point, being someone who has been diagnosed with a generalized anxiety disorder, I was overwhelmed and ready to go home. She proceeded to then say to me, "Fine then. Adios." I feel as if the entire situation was unprofessional on many different levels. I decided to keep searching for a new doctor. I would not advise this practice if you want to get to know your doctor for long term use, or have anxiety issues, seeing as how it is the only doctor's office I have ever been in where the lobby is loud and over packed.

text: I have struggled with my weight now for about 3 years. Due to my age,  losing weight became impossible. A friend of mine recommended their program and so I took a chance and signed up. name: Jo Dee Musselman
text:
Dr. Kirk Jackson has been our family’s primary physician for fifteen years and consistently has provided kind and professional care..  He is a fine and perceptive diagnostician truly listening to his patients as they explain their symptoms.  His ability to do so is important because time and medicines are not wasted.
If a patient needs a referral to a specialist, he matches the patient to that physician ensuring a productive outcome..
Dr. Jackson truly cares about the life circumstances of each patient which is vitally important because the patient will be more compliant with the treatment plan.  A patient wants to be “heard” by an unjudgemental health team.  The sraff is chosen carefully and reflects the values of his practice.
We feel fortunate to have this fine doctor and his staff to expeditiously respond to our medical need  and, at the same time, leaving us with the warm feeling that “cure” has been accompanied by sincere “care”.

name: Christopher Tate
text: If you are seeking a physician who is knowledgeable, patient oreinted, caring, compassionate, available when YOU need need medical care - then Doctor Kirk Jackson should be your doctor!

text: He is very bright but equally arrogant.  He recommend specialists but then will not show interest in their opinions.

name: Lora Vest
text: I called to try to schedule an appointment with Dr. Jackson and of course I didn't mind seeing the Nurse Practitioner for my first appointment.  The problem was I needed a day that I could also reschedule my patients or try to get a day that I already had another appointment scheduled in order to refrain from taking so many days off work.  The receptionist was obviously stressed or too busy to spend over 30 seconds on the phone. When I asked her to repeat what time she said she yelled it out.  After that I asked when the Nurse would be available in Janurary, her response was, "Ok, just what time do you need." I felt like she was too quick and sarcastic to answer a simple question. As a health care provider myself, I treat ever patient with respect they deserve no matter how busy or far behind I am and I depend on the office employees to ensure every patient is taken care of and treated correctly.  I was not impressed with my first impression and I'm sure Dr Jackson is a terrific Doctor.  It's really a shame.

name: Jeremy Goforth
text: Best doctor in town

name: kristi gibbons
text: The ONLY reason this rating isn't a 5+ is the wait time. The staff are all wonderful and Dr Green makes you feel as if you are the only patient in the world. He is an excellent diagnostician and a great communicator...he always makes certain that you understand what's going on without "talking down" to you. We have also met with Chris and Hallie on occasion and they are both very thorough, competent, and compassionate. So, even though the wait time seems excessive, Dr Green and his well chosen staff make it worth the wait.

resp.text: Wow - we really appreciate your kind and thoughtful words.  When it comes to our patients' health, we think that a visit simply takes however long it takes.  We abhor the idea of asking our patients to "come back next week" just to address the fourth, fifth, and sixth items on their list of concerns simply because they wouldn't fit into the 15-minute slot that the doctor was willing to provide; ultimately, that delays care and often leads to the patient spending more time overall at the office - not to mention the extra copayment. At the same time, we loathe waiting too, and we are focused on reducing the "however long it takes" part of visits, WITHOUT sacrificing the quality and detail of service - because quality MUST come before efficiency. The healthcare system that most primary care practices must operate in today doesn't promote high-quality care; one reason is that providing detailed care takes more time than it should.  It's time that the systems were designed from scratch.  Stay tuned.

name: Michelle Creacy
text: Out initial visit was excellent! My husband and I both saw Hallie, the PA. She was very thorough and knowledgeable. After 2 years of seeing a DO, who never once checked out heart rate and lungs,  it was a relief when that was one of the first things she checked... finding a slight heart murmur and an extra beat in my heart rhythm, she did an EKG in the office and after consulting with Dr. Green, scheduled me for an Echo. I am thankful and we are looking forward to developing a long term relationship with Green Primary Care.

resp.text: We appreciate the time you took to share the details of your experience!  (And Hallie appreciates that you spelled her name correctly!) The model of collaborative practice between PA and MD is intended to work just precisely as you described.  Long-term relationships with our patients are the primary joy of what we do, and we welcome patients who seek the same.  Thanks again for your comments.

name: Stephanie McLaughlin
text: I am not an established patient at Green Primary Care, but I attended a public COVID-19 vaccination clinic that they held at their office. The receptionist (Ashley) at the front desk was very polite, professional, and welcoming. The wait was minimal, the nurse that administered the injection was professional, efficient, and skilled. I haven't met Dr. Green, but the office staff was great!

resp.text: We appreciate the time you took to write down your impressions, Stephanie!

name: Sandra Wayrynen
text: Always nervous with new doctor appointments but this was absolutely a positive experience for me. The staff was professional and pleasant, efficient and respectful. The NP I saw was attentive, nonjudgmental, informative and knowledgeable. I would highly recommend this group as a Primary Care Group.

resp.text: We are ecstatic to read that you had such a pleasing experience!  We strive to surprise those who aren't traditionally comfortable in a doctor's office.   Chris has a wealth of experience and his demeanor puts people at ease.  Thank you for your message.

name: jerrval legette
text: Everyone was nice and friendly. Excellent place for primary care. And they really care about there patients. 10 out of 10

resp.text: We are really happy to hear this!  We do care about our patients, and are glad to know when they feel it.  Thanks for taking the time to let us know.

name: Michael Pace
text: Dr Green, and his entire staff, are the most professional staff I have ever experienced in my 59 years. They also could not be any nicer, no matter how far you you searched. They deserve 5 stars, and more. I am very happy I was referred to Dr Green to be my primary care doctor.

resp.text: Thank you for your gracious feedback, Mr. Pace!

name: Patti Moss
text: Dr. Green and his staff are a caring group. They take time to listen and are thorough in explanations. Both my husband and I are happy that we chose Dr. Tyler Green as our primary care physician.

name: Robert Loncaric
text: The visit with Doctor Green was very pleasant and I felt confident that he is going to figure out was has been ailing me.  The wait in the outer room was longer than i expected.

resp.text: Mr. Loncaric - We appreciate your kind words.  It's very important to us that our patients receive thoughtful advice, regardless of how long that may require.  At times that doesn't take long, and with  simple things, time is of the essence.  Yet, our patients often come see us for concerns that aren't so simple.  Our philosophy in our system is that speed can accompany quality (as with simple things), and quality can come before speed (which is often necessary for things that aren't so simple), but speed can never come before quality of the hierarchy of priorities.  Thanks again for your feedback!

name: Carolyn Cunningham
text: I like Dr. Green because his knowledge is current and he doesn't rush through your appointment to go on to the next one. Even though I don't see him often,  he is familiar with me and my health issues. The ONLY drawback is the wait. I always schedule for a first appointment of the day to avoid the longest wait times. that occur with later appointments.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words, Ms. Cunningham!  We believe quality must always come before speed, and are continuously working on improving both.  We also have faster options depending on the type of care our patients need.

name: Scott Moss
text:
We are new patients, we had a good experience with the Nurse Practitioner (Chris), we've not met Dr. Green yet. We just had physicals and don't have to see a doctor very often thankfully. I will say their EMR system is just so-so. Even after almost a month, our labs did not post to our account. They did send them in private messages but I feel it would be helpful if your medical records and tests were easily accessible.

In my experience, I generally never have issues with medical professionals, it is the support people that usually cause difficulty (office and billing).

My recommendations, post lab results promptly to the patient account. It would have been nice for our first visit to have been with Dr. Green.

resp.text: Mr. Moss - Thank you for the kind words about Chris - we consider it a privilege to take care of our patients.  We share your feelings about the labs.  Just to clarify, in most cases, as in your case, we review our patient's lab results as quickly as we can, almost always within a couple of days of our receipt of the data.  Then, if the patient requests that we we do so (and not every patient desires that we do), we will share the results on the portal, where they can be seen by the patient directly.  Exactly how the results are displayed on the portal, however, depends upon how the lab sends us the results.  If the lab provides results to us in a structured, computer-friendly format (which we prefer), they will appear in the "lab" section; on the other hand, if we receive them via fax, we will forward those pages to the patient in PDF format, which can be viewed on the portal as well, in the "messages" section.  We agree it would be much better if every lab provided their results in structured format, but not all lab vendors are doing that just yet.  We are working hard with our lab vendors to make that a reality, and have been for some time.  We expect that in the very near future, virtually all of our patients' results, including labs drawn here at the office, will be received in a structured way (and, in turn, passed along to the patient that way).  We would like to make things as easy and intuitive as possible, and we agree that would help.  Also, if you would like to see Dr. Green, just give us a call and we will be happy to move up your follow-up appointment sometime sooner.  Thanks again for giving us a chance to take care of you.

name: Debby Griffith
text: Friendly, efficient staff; clean and comfortable office environment.

resp.text: Thanks for your encouraging words, Ms. Griffith!

name: Debbie Hansen
text: We recently moved her and chose Green Primary Care. We like Dr Green and really don’t want to to go through the hassle of finding a new doctor so soon. But only having come twice now, we both are considering a new office. In each of two visits a piece we have waited for over an hour before even seeing him. My husband left a msg for him and he, nor a nurse never returned the call. What if it had been an emergency?

resp.text: Ms. Hansen, thanks for the kind words about our doctor.  We understand the frustration of waiting for someone.  Suffice it to say that this spring and summer have certainly been trying seasons for us all, in healthcare and in other areas of life, and our continuing efforts to perfect the patient experience haven't yet consistently manifested in shorter wait times for patients.  Some day soon, they will.  We give each of our patients all of the time they need, and we can only hope that you and your husband have felt that.  We strive to get the right care to the right patient at the right time, and for that reason we have two other providers in our practice at present, an NP and a PA.  They are both quite skilled at treating complex patients, but they naturally tend to see patients for visits that are less complex on average than those handled exclusively by the doctor, and so for some patients there are many times that they may offer a more efficient healthcare encounter.  Consider visiting one of them in the future, and we believe you will find it to be a pleasant experience that you may even prefer.  Every patient will be seen by the doctor periodically as well, and the doctor is always available when necessary.  With respect to the question regarding a return call, we wouldn't want to discuss the specifics of a particular patient's situation in a public forum; however, if there were an urgent matter, we would ask that in the regrettable event that you don't hear back from us promptly, that you simply reach out to us again to check on the status of the issue and to reiterate the urgency of the matter; if there were to be a medical emergency, we would recommend that you seek care at a hospital emergency department and call an ambulance if necessary.  We thank you for giving us the opportunity to care for you and your husband, and we hope to see you again soon.

name: Mark Clark
text: I am sure that Doctor Green is very capable and he seems friendly.   But this office has no regard for the patients' time.  You will wait here for very long times, even the first appointment of the day.   They automatically charge double  for physicals that are covered 100% by insurance.

resp.text: Mark, thanks for the feedback.  We believe you bring up an important point that we would like to highlight.  It’s true that patients sometimes have a wait to see their doctor or practitioner, and we take no pleasure in it when a patient is upset.  We would respectfully disagree, though, that this is due to a lack of regard for our patients’ time.  In fact, we see it as quite the opposite.  We take our time with our patients.  Most patients have many questions, each of which deserves respect, and we strive to consider each one thoroughly at the time it is asked, rather than asking the patient to arbitrarily pick just one or two and return for yet another appointment at another time to handle the rest, which would delay care for weeks or months and require another trip to the office (and possibly another copayment).  We document the decisions we make together in a thoroughly detailed manner, often in the presence of the patient, which takes some time but improves the quality of care and communication.  We also care for our own patients in the hospital, which makes care in the hospital more safe, comfortable, and efficient. (This also means that the first patient in the office on a given day is probably not the first patient of the day overall.)  Whenever possible, we address routine screening and wellness concerns at each visit, so the patient does not have to wait until the annual “wellness” or “physical” visit to receive that care; whenever appropriate, depending on the medical situation, we may perform that service on the same day as a visit for specific medical problems, to save the patient some time; the total cost to the patient is the same, and in some cases the total reimbursement to the practice is less, but most importantly the patient doesn’t have to make an extra trip to the office.  We acknowledge that life is full of trade-offs, and some of the ones we choose to make at our practice have occasionally resulted in wait times longer than we would like.  We are continuously working to improve that, and we are absolutely confident that we will as our systems and workflows improve, but the truth is that the vast majority of our patients believe that it has been worth it, and we would agree with them.  We have tremendous respect for our patients, their time, and their concerns, and we are proud to provide medical care in a way that we are confident reflects that respect - even if it’s necessary to wait at times to experience it.  We consider it a privilege to care for you as our patient and hope to see you again soon.

name: David Gaither
text: My wife went to a wellness evaluation with dr. Green. During this visit she told him of problems she was having and he prescribed medicine and told her of some labs he wanted her to take. We called our insurance and verified these labs were ok. Later after the labs we get a bill for $550. Two labs on this bill that were not covered were never discussed with my wife and she did not know she was having them done. I called the dr. Office and his nurse said the dr. Added these labs and she said they have been having problems with insurance companies not covering them. I asked her why the dr. Did not discuss this with my wife first and the only thing she told me was that the cdc recommends them. Well the CDC is not my insurance company. I called my insurance and asked what was the problem. They told me that the dr sent them the wrong codes. That he sent routine codes instead of diagnostic codes. They called him and asked for the diagnostic codes and he refused to give them the codes saying there were no other codes that can be given. Well I think the insurance company would know if there were no other codes or not. Anyway I called the dr. And asked them why would they knowingly have my wife take labs, they did not discuss with her first, knowing our insurance probably would not pay for if it is only routine and not for a diagnostic purpose. I still have no answer and a big bill for something my wife neither needed or was told he was doing.I DONT TRUST THESE PEOPLE, I CANNOT TRUST dR. gREEN TO DO WHAT IS MEDICALLY AND MORALLY BEST FOR ME AND WIFE.

resp.text: Sir, We are sorry that you are so upset. We are generally meticulous about discussing each diagnostic test that we order with each patient, and the reason for doing so. That's important, in part, for this very reason - we can never know with complete certainty what an insurance company may or may not cover. And, of course, our medical decisions are made, first and foremost, with the good of the patient in mind; whether the insurance company decides to cover them, while important, is a secondary consideration. Medical decisions are made between the patient and the doctor, and no one should come in between that sacred bond. There are various different reasons that a test might be felt to be indicated - sometimes to evaluate an active problem, and other times to screen for a potential problem - and the tests and treatments we select are generally chosen according to scientific evidence and/or according to the clinical guidelines that define the standard of medical care in our country. The "codes" are used to communicate the reasons for tests to the insurance company; sometimes there is more than one code that could be used for a given test for a given patient (because there may be several reasons a test is ordered at a certain point in time), and other times there is really only one code that is appropriate. Some tests the insurance company may decide that they will never cover, and others they may cover only for certain reasons (which can change without notice). If they choose not to cover a test, it's usually not so much because the "wrong" code was sent, but rather because they have chosen not to cover that test for the reason it was ordered. If we can ever provide them other reasons, or codes, that weren't submitted at first because the first set of reasons sent seemed to the doctor to be an adequate explanation, then we will send those additional codes. But sometimes, all of the reasons we supply just aren't enough to get the insurance company to cover the test. Sometimes there are other codes that might get them to cover the test, but these aren't really the "right" codes unless they actually apply to the reasons the test was ordered for that patient at that time. We understand you are upset, and we understand why. But we would respectfully suggest that your concerns about lack of coverage are better directed to your medical insurance plan, which may have a different idea of "medical necessity" than your doctor, and we would further respectfully suggest that you consider that your doctor is the one that defines medical necessity, and that while the doctor has nothing to gain from ordering more tests, the insurance company could potentially have something to gain from declining to pay for some tests. We stand behind the reasons we order all of the tests we order, and the reasons are quite thoroughly documented in each patient's medical record, and we refuse to let another entity dictate to us what is appropriate for our patients.  We strive to review all the tests ordered and their reasons, but there is a lot that goes on during medical appointments, particularly ones that are conducted in-depth as ours are, and while we also work to ensure that the patient understands very well the plan of care, it's quite a lot to ask the patient to also remember every last test ordered and the exact reason why. While it would be great if the patient could remember all of that, that's really more the job of the doctor to take care of that in the medical record. If we failed to mention a test and the reason for it, we certainly wish to apologize. We would just ask you to consider the possibility that all of the tests ordered may have been discussed with your wife, and perhaps she was understandably more focused on the problem that was bothering her than on all of the screening tests that were also being ordered as part of a comprehensive visit. We consider it a privilege to care for our patients and will do whatever we can to be of service.

Time is valuable for anyone. They sure wouldn't wait for a patient to be an hour late for the appointment, why should I wait for him? I want to stress that even while listening to my short rant about how F'ed up the situation was, the staff remained friendly and courteous.
